thread.title: Two Arrested After Cash Box Stolen From Event
thread.title_full: Two Arrested After Cash Box Stolen From Event

title: Two Arrested After Cash Box Stolen From Event
text:
October 13, 2015, 12:06 PM by Brandon Van Westen SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Two men charged with DUI over the weekend were attempting to steal a cashbox from a bar when a pregnant employee tried to stop them. 
Just after midnight Sunday, a Sioux Falls Police officer was in a parking lot at Hy-Vee, 3000 S Minnesota Ave., when he saw a Ford Explorer crash into a pole. The driver fled the scene and was found in a friend's car at 32nd Street and Grange Avenue. 
On Tuesday, Public Information Officer Sam Clemens said 23-year-old Austin Johnson was at The Nickel Spot, 2918 S Minnesota Ave., during an event. Clemens said Johnson ran out with a cash box and a 30-year-old event employee chased after him. 
Previous Story: Suspected Thief Knocks Down Woman, Crashes Into Pole 
The woman was standing the Explorer's running boards while Johnson was driving away. She was left with a broken left arm and right leg, and Clemens said her pregnancy should be unaffected by the injuries. 
Clemens said Johnson called 22-year-old Christopher Rave to pick him up. Both were found inside Rave's vehicle nearby. 
Johnson is charged with a DUI, two counts of aggravated assault, vehicular battery, felony hit and run, and petty theft. Rave is charged with his third DUI, petty theft, suspended license, no insurance, and open container. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
